column4: hi, i am trying to install a dual boot sys. and i am having trouble with GParted, the error  was a logic error saying bad sector
HDC possibly failed opcode: 0x0a
HELP!
Paninking!
I think your disk is bad.
you can try factory-erasing it (use Hiren's boot CD).
before doing that check if you have some problem on another OS or distro
it already has windows? so the disk is not broken :D
I think that you have some trouble on detected disk geometry. When does gparted throw that error?
main menu?
yes i am running it a a live CD.
so you can't boot the live-cd?
The disk makes a menu pop up and i tell it which option to run
No, i can boot it, it's just that after i choose and option and it trys to load
can you choose the option to run ubuntu without making changes?
i have 2 discs, one with ubuntu 9.10 and another with GParted on it. I am getting errors with GParted disc
I have not tried the Ubuntu disc
you can run gparted from the ubuntu CD :)
K, can you run me through the setup while i am doing it? You know, help me as we go.
start the live enviroment with the run without making changes option and go to System -> Administration -> Gparted Partiiton Editor
now I have to go, it's late, but you can ask anyone in the channel :)
good luck !
Thanks
